about.title: About the project
content: This project was developed by me, Lilith Díaz, for the "Global Catastrophic Risks" program of the organization Careers with Impact.
For technical details and write-up consult

objectives.title: Project's Objectives
content: This project aims to address the area of biological risks by creating a repository that stores information of epidemiologic importance from the past 25 years in Mexico (2000-2024).

This data collection will aid future event analysis to not only facilitate Mexico's response to these risks but also that of other countries: comparing responses will facilitate the creation of strategies tailored to particular cases.

news.title: News and updates about the project
content: Official presentation of the proyect and deployment of the page on August 10th, 2024.

exploreData.title: Explore Data
exploreData.instructions: To search for information in the database, select the disease and then the filters of interest.
exploreData.specifications: If you find a field in the database with the notation IND, it means the information wasn't available in the original source.
exploreData.actualization: This database is updated until July 2024.
exploreData.instructionUserFilters: To unselect a filter, click on it.

diseases.title: Diseases
diseases.cases: Y-axis: Number of Detected Cases of

data.title: Acute respiratory infections
data.fileContent:
The information presented in this database was collected from all the PDFs of national morbidity from 2000 to 2022 provided by the General Directorate of Epidemiology of Mexico. 
This database contains the following information: pathogen, classification of the pathogen; detected cases and deaths by year and place of origin.

resources.name: BWC Legislation Database
resources.description: The database contains examples of legislation covering criminal provisions, biosafety and biosecurity measures, export control measures and enforcement.

resources.name: ePATHogen - Risk Group Database
resources.description: To conduct searches in biological agents.

resources.name: Dual-Use Quickscan
resources.description: The purpose of this online Dual-Use Quickscan is to identify potential dual-use aspects in research.

resources.name: Biosecurity Self-scan Toolkit
resources.description: The toolkit is in the form of a questionnaire covering the eight pillars of biosecurity that is designed to give you an indication of the current level of biosecurity in your organisation.

resources.name: Biocheck.UGent surveys
resources.description: Biocheck.UGent is a scoring system to measure biosecurity risk at the farm level. The tool allows farmers to quantify the biosecurity risks associated with cattle, pig, poultry, and small ruminants.

resources.name: Dual-Use Oversight
resources.description: The International Experts Group of Biosafety and Biosecurity Regulators (IEGBBR) developed the IEGBBR Mobile Application that allows users to search through detailed descriptions of the national regulatory oversight approaches from the 11 IEGBBR member countries.

resources.name: Canadian Biosafety App
resources.description: The Canadian Biosafety App allows users to engage with the Canadian Biosafety Standards (CBS) by finding the requirements that are specific to your facility.

resources.name: Biorisk Adventure
resources.description: By playing this game, you will learn how to apply knowledge and make sound judgements in the selection of appropriate risk-control measures that are achievable using the local resources available, are not overly restrictive, and enable the work to proceed safely and securely.

resources.name: Covid simulator
resources.description: This game will let you step into the place of a government that must decide what mitigation measures to take. You will try out managing situations connected to the coronavirus epidemic and see the consequences of your decisions in detail.
